text: Bottle. Aroma is nice: banana profile, fruit esters, yeast. Medium-full body, light carbonation. Flavors are also nice and follow the nose. Really enjoyable!
Bière flamande, ça mérite quelques points doffice. En plus, elle est réussie. Houblon discret, pas damertume trop marquée, petite douceur qui équilibre le tout.
Bottle - orange with large frothy white head. Good orangey/banana Wheaty aroma. Lovely tasting, full flavour and lasting - excellent.
Bière blonde forte, parfaite en accompagnement dun repas du Nord. Pas damertume laissée en bouche.

Bottle from the Beer Souvenir Palace, Bugge. Hazed amber with some sediment. Soft textured for its strength, which isnt apparent. Has a light sugary-fruity nose, with a similarly light fruity taste. Some yeast, some pale malt.

From 330ml Bottle. Pours amber with head fading to lacing. Quite a pronounced bitterness on the tongue in the aftertaste and a strong but refreshing palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bu au bon accueil à bousbecque ! 
Chez mon ami axel !
Pression de 33cl.
Verre anosteke 33cl.
Couleur dorée très beau reflet ! 
Belle mousse bien aéré ! 
Au nez : cest malté et vanille , petite note de houblon.
En bouche : cest très léger , assez longue, savoureuse. Note vanillé et sucrosité très bonne . Note de houblon très agréable calibre le tout !
Agréable.

Nagy, nagyon tartós hab, borostyán szín. Illata malátás, enyhén citrusos és virágos. Malátás, karamelles ízvilág, citrusos, zöldfűszeres aromákkal. Közepesen testes, erősen szénsavas, közepesen keserű. Kellemes, markáns ízvilágú sör.
Bottle at home. Pleasent hops and swet malts aroma. Big, bubbly head with a lot of fizzy action. I taste grapes, resin, sweet malt. Very good.
On tap at Chinaski. Golden with white head. Aroma and taste are sweet pale malt, sugar, grass, yeast, slight fruit and hay

Keyaki fall 2016. Apple and pear on the nose with good fruit esters. Alcohol well-hidden. Some clove and light spice on the palate. Light, maybe some wheat in there. Finish has some light pepper and soft fruit. I like it.

Robe blonde tirant sur lorange, légèrement trouble, brumeuse. Mousse blanche, col court, rétention moyenne. Nez balancé entre le malt, le grain et le houblon herbeux, avec notes levurées. Prometteur. Première gorgée soyeuse et complexe. Amertume claire qui tapisse la langue, sur laquelle se déploie des notes maltées (pain, biscuit), mais peu de sucre. Le houblon apporte un agréable biais végétal, herbeux, quasi terreux. Alcool impeccablement intégré. Bullage assez important, corps moyen. Longueur amère importante. Bière à rapprocher dune Belgian strong ale avec des caractéristiques de Saison (grains présent, amertume). Buvable, mais complexe et assez riche.

75cl bottle. Foamy white head with hoppy Lemongrass flavors. Hazy yellow colored body. Pleasant, thick and balanced in mouth. On the citrus

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Blond bier met wit schuim. Geur: hoppig, fruitig, moutzoetig. Smaak: bitterig en moutzoetig. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: bitterig.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 24C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch L160647. AROMA: moderate malty sweet aroma and almost clean with moderate spicy alcohol aromatics. medium-low esters resembling sweet oranges. APPEARANCE: golden color and translucent. moderate-low white head with medium retention and leg formation. TASTE: medium-low malty sweet flavor and almost neutral. slight spicy notes. medium-low bitterness with a dry and bitter finish. malt balanced. very faint cereal hull note. PALATE: medium-low body with a slight texture. medium carbonation. slight astringency and alcohol warmth. OVERALL: a biere de garde with a bit alcoholic presence and low complexity.

Bottle at t Kasteelhof in the charming hilltop city of Cassel, France on Aug. 2014: Clear golden. Fine-bubbled sticky white head persists nicely. Phenolic and lemon zesty nose also boasts peach skin, grassy herbs, pepper, flowers and new-mown hay. Very subtle note of resin and raw hops. Soft and relaxed carbonation. Vibrant hops show a smidgeon of greenness as theyre cradled by pillowy pils malt and a succulent fruity ester push. A firm-edged toastiness underlies the softer textures and highlights the ripe melon notes. Forceful phenolic burst trails the vital crispness of the pils malt. A wealth of bright hop oils match the fine-tuned bitterness splendidly, although a hint of resin does make an appearance. Cleanly expressed malt fills the mouth with hay-dust textures, as an assertive hop charge of pepper, grassy herbs and lemon zest seals the admirably dry finish. A hopcentric rustic golden ale whose only shortcoming is the slightly "green" hoppiness. Otherwise terrific balance and quite elegant. Easy to enjoy.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Smell of yeast, grapefruit. Yellow colour, foamy white head. Aroma of yeast, sugar, grapefruit, some honey, a faint of pepper. Sweet. Soft carbon, oily texture.

Bottle 0.33l at Ratebeer tasting Borresteijn place Zaandam Netherlands.15.04.2016.Taste with Borresteijn, Zlotta, Potjebier, adamnowek, skortila, MarcoDL and Harmen. Pour it hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma sweet, some molasis. Taste starts with sweet yeasty flavor, grassy on the back, finish bitterish harsh. Ok

Sampled from bottle at Borresteijns place. Slightly hazy, golden amber with a tan head. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity aroma of caramel, honey and mango. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity taste of caramel, honey and mango, followed by a short, slightly bitter finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!

I usually find blond beers too "light", too "wattery"... not this one. Nice long lasting pure white creamy foam. Smell of corn, yeast, crops. Perfectly balanced taste of malt and hop. Perfect bitterness. No oversweetness (its the case in most of the beers). The smell of crops, it smells like a farm, a pure strong and lovely smell of crops, just this feeling brings back memories. And this taste of malt and hop, sooo good. Try this out if you like blond style, you wont be disappointed !

Hazy, deeper amber colored, small to medium white creamy head, good lacing. Aroma is of caramel and brewing sugar, very fruity and decent amount of spice, yeast. Taste is medium sweet brewing sugar, caramel, strong fruits and less spice, medium- spicy phenolic and strawy bitterness, bit Belgian yeast, noticeable alcohol, bit bready finish. Medium bodied, soft+ carbonation, oily.
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)
75 cl bottle @ Chez Alain. Golden with a fluffy white head. Belgian abbey yeast, grains. Sweet with a drier and lightly bitter finish. Average carbonation. A good example of the style.
Pours hazy to the glass and foam fades away such quickly. Aroma is little bit fruity and sweet. Tastes yeasty and sweet, but not too sweet. Nice bitterness comes afterwards. Tastes bit of summer.

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2016 Shared 11.2 oz. bottle. As Anosteké Bière de Garde. Pours pale gold with a white head. Aroma and taste of mild malt and hops with perhaps a bit of apple juice. This isnt bad, but its not that great; inoffensive might be the best term. Hard to believe this is scored in the top 15% of all beers.

Aroma: sweet and malty with apple notes; Appearance: hazy, golden straw with thin head; Taste: sweet and watery with little personality; Palate: light bodied with very soft carbonation; short, sweet finish; Overall: forgettable; would not buy again.

hazy golden colour, half inch creamy white head; aroma of grains, hay and grassy notes, peach, orange zest, earth and wine cellar notes; taste of overripe fruits (peach, maybe pear, and tropical fruits, too), malty sweetness and peppery notes, great!

Keg at Le Palais del la Biere, Lille, France. Gold with thin white head. Thinnish, light beer with a slight drying, hopped character. Some bitter lemon, some grainy, malt. Doesnt really develop to much but its okay.

9/5/2011 12:48:33 PM Thanks jaghana for this great French IPA. Hazy gold body with big head. Nose of hops, bananas and citrus. Quite lovely. Taste is spicy fruits, some hops for sure and citrus. Gets spicier and warmer. Quite a spicy and strong (forte!) IPA. Enjoyable definitely.

Pours very clear blonde, small white head. Smell is bit sweet. Taste is malty, bit sweet (trough yeast) , buttery almost. Very, very mild bitter back. mostly yeasty. OK beer, but not the biggest fan of this type I supose.
Bottle shared. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of weeds, yeast, light caramel and grassy notes. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin white head. Clear golden pour. Easy drinking

bread, hay, grass, herbs, minerals, very much like a pilsener in character, ABV well integrated.
Golden colour, small white head, lacing.
Noticably sweet, bready yeastiness, lightly bitter, Clean, crisp and well balanced.
Fullbodied, small lively bubbles, corny sweet finish.
Solid.
Bottle. Pours a light gold colour with a thin white head, light malt aroma with fruit and sugar, taste is bitter and fruity with a dry bitter finish.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. An orange yellow opaque beer with a small white head ; poor retention. Resin, citrus, herbs, sugar. Medium sweet, medium dry bitter lasting refreshing. Full body, thin texture, average carbonation, dry fruity bitter resinous finish. Overall, a good fruity resinous ale.

Sample at SBWF 2015. 

Slightly hazy copper with a white head. On the sweet side with fruit, hops, some grass and light malt. The finish was fairly bitter. An ok one.

Bouteille 33cl.
Dorée, col crémeux blanc.
Arôme est un peu savonneux, agrumes et houblonné le tout un peu chimique-herbacé mais sans être signe dinfection. Reste cependant assez classique, avec un malté carapils, pâle.
Palais est finement amer et houblonné gardant un profil belge dans la levure qui est marqué de son empreinte par des notes ester.
Retrouve un fini un peu cloying avec un apport réchauffant des 8% et un fruité laissant penser à du raisin blanc.
75 cl. @ Drie Kalders, Saint-Omer. Hazy blond colour white foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet nose of grapefruit and citrus. Malty body, hoppy finish. Good biere de garde.

« Enn biér dé ch Nord », et une bonne 
Non pas une bière de garde, mais une belgian ale, par respect pour le verre dEname que jai 
utilisé pour la déguster !!! Et puis on aime bien taquiner nos amis chtis
Blonde artisanale donc du pays flamand, parce que la Flandre va aussi en France, eh oui, amis 
du centre, du sud ouest ou autre costa de azuro 
Dailleurs le brasseur a trouvé le slogan ad hoc : « pensez global, consommez local »  qui disait.
Sont fous ces chtis ..
Couleur dorée soutenue et brillante, avec un léger trouble de levure (voulu au versage).
Bulles moyennes par dizaines, partout dans le verre, vives.
Mousse blanche crémeuse, qui tient en nappage bien crémeux à 2 mm.
Arômes de malt clair, un autre bien grillé, houblon, pointe de beurre, butterscotch, levure.
1ère bouche bien soyeuse, au très bel ensemble mat/houblon, et une pointe dépices.
Arrière-bouche de caractère, déjà à léquilibre.
2ème à lexcellente harmonie malt/houblon.
Arrière-bouche longue et complexe, très belle amertume.
3ème avec une belle présence dune amertume précise, nette.
Arrière-bouche de très grand caractère.
Longueur qui développe les saveurs, avec du houblon très joli, des fruits blancs, du tabac blond.
Jambes lisses, marquées.
Levure précise, amère, un peu épicée, très belle ligne.
Alcool de très bon niveau, progressif, soutien manifeste à lensemble.
Finale avec un nez superbe, une grande finesse des saveurs et du style ..
CONCLUSION : une belgian ale de chNord qui na pas à rougir de ses voisins du Nord (encore plus au nord  je sais, cest compliqué, mais chacun sait de qui on parle  enfin, dans le Nord
en tous les cas ). Fin de la parenthèse, non sans féliciter fortement ces nordistes flamands ...Je sais, cest compliqué, mais si on va à Gand (Gent) ou à Bruges (Brugge) en passant par la braderie de Lille (Rijsel), on risque darriver à comprendre !!! Bon courage, donc, pour le circuit, non sans
déguster une bière du pays flamand (français) pour vous aider  Anosteké, disaient les basques ...
Bottle. Blonde, hazy. Lemon and soft grassy notes in the aroma and flavor. malty sweetish. herbal, anis. Not too bad.

Dorada turbia de bonita espuma. Excelente aroma frutal, platano futa tropical. En boca textura cremosa y agradable sabor, de base malteada. De nuevo muy frutal, ligeramente dulce, salvo en el final, mas seco. 8 grados? Debe ser una broma.. Ni rastro. Es una cerveza estupenda.

Aroma: roots (celery, carrot), light fruits.
Taste: light to moderate sweetness, light bitterness.
Flavour: yeasty ethers, some black pepper, fresh vegetables (celery root, parsley root).

Strange but pleasant.
Almost clear golden color with small head. Aroma is yeast forward, lets you know its a belgian style. Fruity aroma with some light spice character and bitter finish. Decent beer but nothing special.
BOTTLE 33CL from artemb. Hazy straw, regular head. Aroma of celery, carrots, orchard fruit, kinda vegetable sweetness. The taste is dry, vegetable, fragrant perfumey sweetness, some spice.
Bottle from Systembolaget Web Shop. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, yeasty and light spicy. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 170715

Dimmig, bärnstens gul, vitt skum. Doft: Malt, gräs, jäst, som jag tänker biere de garde, humle, honungs te. Smak: Humle, frukt, belgo i munnen tills man svalt då humlen och de typiska garde smakerna kommer.

golden yellow, hazy, small white foam, some lacing; fruity, yeasty aroma with some spices; medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour; medium+ body, quite thick and little bit creamy feel, average- carbonation, long dry and bitter finish;
Overall: well hidden alcohol, nice aroma and taste, quite high drinkability, no flaws

(Draught at BrewDog Stockholm) Hazy golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity nose with notes of citrus, peaches, tropical fruit and spicy yeast. An initial funky sourness fades away after a while. Fruity taste with citrus, apricots, green grapes, hay and a certain spicy, citric bitterness in a fairly dry finish. Almost full body, quite dry. Interesting and tasty, with a slight funkiness in the background. Nice one.

Le nez est frais et houblonné ! Ça donne leau à la bouche.
Le première gorgée pète en bouche dans la légère amertume du houblon qui déquilibre avec un superbe goût de céréales genre blé.
On trouve enfin des notes de pamplemousse.
Le tout a un superbe équilibre. Le corps est présent mais reste agréable.

Dourada,turva,espuma abundante e duradoura;aroma frutado com notas florais e de especiarias;sabor delicioso,igualmente frutado,presença de frutas amarelas,banana,fermento,lúpulos contrabalanceando bem com o malte,corpo médio,boa carbonação,álcool bem inserido,só é notado a medida que a cerveja esquenta,refrescante.

Keyaki. Very caramelly, little spice, bit sweet. Feels different from how it looks and described. More boozy than blond.
Nice though.
330ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy yellow orange with a white head. Aroma of Belgian style yeast, perfume and bread. Dry bitterness in the finish. Like a tripel.

Aroma: Musty, damp basement notes, hay and lemon peel; solid peppery hoppiness. Appearance: Translucent gold with a foamy white head that fades into a skin. Flavor: Musty up front and a little throughout, somewhat lemony and more peppery toward the finish, which is lightly bitter and pretty dry. Palate: Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation, lingering finish. Overall: Makes me think more of old school Saison than Biere de Garde; either way its a very fine beer.

Bottle 33cl. Clear medium golden color, good two finger frothy white head, good retention, light lacing; sweet fruity nose, grapes, candy sugar, grass, light citrus; taste medium sweet and bitter, fruity, malty; medium body, bit sharp mouthfeel, oily texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste dry bitter, spicy notes and alcohol make it a bit sharp in the finish.

The beer pours golden with a large white head that fades quickly, and its made cloudy by the lots of dark, fine-grain sediment floating throughout. The aroma blends light malts, grain, citrus hops, and sage. The taste blends a mild sweetness and a touch of sourness, and the flavor is light and slightly citrusy (lemon and orange) with only a hint of spice. The palate fuses a lively carbonation, light body, and a slick texture.

Où, Quand, Comment :  Bouteille. Mondial de la bière 2013.


Visuel :  
Couleur : dorée. 
Apparence : voilée. 


Arôme :  
Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes) et épicées, moyen de houblon herbeux aux notes citriques, léger de malt sucré avec des notes de pain


Goût :  
Levures fruitées (agrumes) et poivrées, moyen-léger amer de houblon herbeux avec des notes florales et citriques, léger de grains de malt sucrés avec des notes de pain ainsi que des traces de caramel terreux


En bouche :  

Corps : moyen-mince.
Effervescence : moyenne.
Texture : très légèrement crémeuse.
Finale : moyenne et aux notes sèches, léger-moyen amer de houblon herbeux avec un léger goût de levures épicées 



En Résumé :  Un bel exemple de Belgian IPA.

Slightly hazy golden to light orange with medium head, dissipates. Aroma is sweet light malt, light phenolic, candy-sugary, strange herbal and mineraly off flavor with light herbal-lemony tones. Taste follows in the same pattern. I cant recognize the off flavor as time goes by and the beer gets warmer. Nice spicy herbal hoppy aftetaste.
Light carbonation, medium body, hint of tartness.
This beer is almost perfect. Full of flavors. I love the yeast nose and the well balanced hoppiness.
Nice belgian hoppy tripel! The taste of belgian yeast associated with American hops.
Bottle at home. Medium body and medium carbonation. Yellow color with a big white head. Bitter finish that make it interesting.
Bière consommée en pression .. très bonne surprise .. un peu damertume mais juste assez pour se faire plaisir

75cl bottle. Pour is hazy golden with thick white head, nice lacing. Aromas of stale bread, hay and ripe fruit. Taste is bitter, earthy and balanced. Aftertaste is dry and hoppy with stale finish. Nice and interesting beer.
stubby bad news bottle .. . foamy little bugger .. . bread and dirty hay .. mild sweetness in the back .. . rad taste, decent brew! .. . . milk and cookies? overrated.

On tap @ Kerelshof - Cassel - FR. Color: blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: fruity and exotic notes and grassy with fresh hops. Taste: nice hoppy taste fresh and fruity well balanced with malt notes and really nice work. Aftertaste: nice sweet bitterness and caramel notes.
Bottle from Capsule & Bouchon, Baumes-les-Dames. Pour is with a head, aroma is fruity, yeasty, apricot. Taste is pretty much the same, little carbonation, gentle bitterness and light acidity. Good!
Peary, lightly sweet, a bit of booze, drinkable despite the ABV. Sorta plain but good nonetheless. Bit of a gusher.
Very unusual, but I couldnt finish even my glass because of the bitterness that took my mouth by surprise. Ouch.
Pale yellow colour, hazy. Fine and creamy foam. Obvious smell of hops, orange, smooth. Full bitterness, fine and long. A lot of character.
Bottle, gold pour, white head, nose is pear, taste is pear, honey, tart, decent

Robe d'un blond pâle et légèrement trouble
Arômes fleuri de houblon évoquant le citron et les agrumes
Saveurs très fleuries et fruitées, belle et puissante amertume
Draught at GJBF Yokohama 2014. Tart, pear, honey, spice. Quite a pleasant surprise, very smooth for such a strong brew.
Bottle from Calais Vins. Pours golden with a very thin layer of white froth. A nicely balanced beer with good bitterness, spice, citrus, caramel undertones and a hint of herbs.

Appearance: this beer jumped out of the bottle as soon as I popped the top, pours with a very large off white head, the beer is a very hazy darker golden color with particles floating in it, head settles in average time 
Aroma: fruit, lemon, yeast, sour, tart, lime, smells very good
Taste: has a sour tang to it, Im getting lime again, hints of bitterness on the finish, white wine
Palate: lively carbonation, even fizzy, has a weak sour aftertaste, light mouthfeel, dry
Overall: not what I was expecting at all but this is pretty delicious, hides the abv very well, more of a sour beer, the lime is unique too

Bottle at t Kasteelhof in Cassel.
An intriguing hoppy blonde combining lemon-y Styrian Golding hops with sweet pastry bread malt. Juicy in the mouth, floral with citrus pith bitterness and subtle white pepper spiciness. Yeast is slightly pasty / starchy, lending a drying effect to the hoppy astringency which grows in the finish, with balance maintained well by succulent malt sugar. Tart and sweet and bitter, medium-bodied with creamy carbonation and long drying noble hop finish.
Alors là, non ! Un seul mot à dire : acidité. Cest triste à dire mais nous navons même pas pu la finir.

Whole Foods Bowery, NYC bottle ($4): Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is honey, earthy, fruity, and a bit herbal. Taste is much the same. The beer wasnt too sweet, nor was it particularly bitter. It was just a nice fruity Belgian Blonde. This was sold as a bier de garde, but I did not get much of that style from here.
Bottle from La Route des Bieres in Aix. Sweet, some citrus, malty, with the alcohol certainly prevalent. Somewhat cloudy appearance. Good beer.

Bottle at GJBF Osaka 2014. Juicy, fruity nose, with citrus and some honey. Peachy initial flavor, honey come out, and alc. is quite apparent. The light bittering and alc. create a double punch in mid. A bit harsh, though, more than a blonde should be. Bitter, a bit heavy going, but fairly tasty.
Bottle pour at GJBF Osaka 2014. Spicy, yeasty nose, citrus, grass. Spicy and sweet falvor, hoppy. Decently tasty and refreshing even.
Hazy blonde pour with a white head. Aromas of yeast and spice. Flavor is sweet funk and malt. Solid brew.

A little confused by the bierre de garde label but this a one fine beer nevertheless! Has a very good murky golden pour w/ a white head that leaves lacing. The aroma is of subtle Belgian spices. The taste is quite complex starting out quite spicy & finishing almost bitter. The mouthfeel is light & smooth but rich enough to carry to flavor. Good stuff!

75 cl bottle @ PBF IX. BBE 01/2015.
Pours cloudy golden color with a large white head. Citric fruits on the nose, some herbal notes and yeast. A bit spicy flavor. some lemony fruits, grass and apricot on the finish. Strong carbonation, sourish palate. Decent.
3344

Golden colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is mild yeast, some spices, citrus and quite bready notes. Flavour is spices, sweet malts, some toffee and mild fruitiness. Alcohol pushes through a bit as well.

750ml bottle @ PBF IX

Pours hazy yellow with a smooth head. Aroma of ripe fruits, yeast, citrus and earthy notes. Taste is floral, earthy, yeasty and ripe fruity with some sweetish notes. Finish is sweetish, earthy and yeasty. Okay.

750 ml bottle @ PBF IX. Pours a cloudy pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma of grains, some floral notes and orange zest. Flavour of pale malts, orange zest, sweetness, Belgian yeast and some floral notes. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A typical blond.

75 cl bottle @ PBF Ⅸ, BBE 01/2015
Aroma is fruity and soapy with apricot and grassy. Somewhat foamy palate. Flavour has grassy hops, apricot, some citrus and hints of apricot. Also some herbal bitterness. Hides the ABV well. A hoppy belgian blonde.

Pours cloudy orange with a white head. The aroma has cellar must, cobwebs, pale light toasty malt, cotton candy and granola. It is medium / full bodied with lots of semi-soft carbonation. The flavor begins with tartness, mustiness, lemon and astringency. The finish has some spice and sourness. Nice, but not what I expected for something labeled as a Bier de garde.

Pour is a cloudy blonde with a average white head. Aroma is fruity, yeasty and clove. Flavor is peach fruitiness, some hefe-like clove and banana and hay malt with a bit of sugar thrown in. Finish is dry but you can get a nice bit of hop resin left over. Pretty solid beer, my bottle says Biere de Garde but I agree this is more of a Belgian blonde.

Bottle. Clear gold with a fizzy white head, slowly diminishing. Aroma of fruit, toasted grain, banana, bubble gum and pepper. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Phenol spicy tastes. Lingering bitterness. A bit of a disconnect between the yeast and the hops.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 Pours a godlen orange with a medium, white head. Aroma is fruity, slight yeast. Taste is sweet and spicy. Very good balanced. Very good!!

Caution: This exploded upon opening with no extra shaking/movement at only a month or so old. Hazy golden coloured body with an orange glow and a thin, white head. The bubbles are gone after having exploded they arent anywhere to be found. Aroma of tons of grass, hay, spice, white pepper, light hops and a lot of herbs. Medium-bodied; Assertive grassy flavour with a lot of wheat and yeast flavours, some light fruits and a hint of herbs in the finish. Aftertaste has a nice balance of barnyardie flavours and malt with tufts of sweetness coming out at the end. Overall, a good example of a biere de garde FROM france, but for some reason this isnt categorised in the proper style - this is not a belgian strong nor a belgian ale of any calibre but a saison at worst and a biere de garde as the closest. I sampled this stubby 33 cL bottle purchased from Whole Foods in New York, New York (Bowery) on 25-April-2014 for US$3.99 sampled at home in Washington on 02-June-2014.
Bottle at home in garden, 1st June 14. Pretty taste Belgian style, slight banana flavour, good carbonation, not bad

330ml bottle. Cloudy golden colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, white head. Saison-like yeasty and herbal aroma, a touch of dill, brine, marinade. Taste is strawy, pale malty, slightly floral yeasty, spicy yeasty, slightly disguised notes of peach. Not bad.
A good example of how north brewers of France can as talentful as belgian brewers.
Color dorado con espuma blanca. Aromas de frutas verdes y herbales. cuerpo medio en boca, entra fresca y ligeramente dulce y afrutada con toques ácidos final seco y amargor herbal moderado. Muy rica.

750 ml bottle poured a hazy yellow with a small lasting white head. Aromas of straw, yeast, barnyard funk and citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, yeast, citrus and light barnyard with a crisp dry lingering straw finish.
Gold pour, fluffy white head. I get a Belgian quality..banana, yeast, light herbal notes. Pretty good.

Bottle states Biere de Garde so here on ratebeer that means not Biere de Garde? Hmmm confusion. Thank you ratebeer. The 750mL bottle pours with a murky deep gold body that supports a dirty white head of foam. The aroma offers up sugary pears and apricot fruitiness as well as some cantaloupe and some spicy yeastiness. The taste starts with soft sugary sweet apricot and pear fruitiness edged by mild tart fruit skins and then flowing into spicy yeast. There is plenty of sweetness here that is trying to be balanced by spices and less sweet fruitiness but it doesnt get there.
Light yellow colour and quite hazy. Very bitter finish with nice fruits, banana and hop aroma. A little bit too bitter beer for me but still I like quite much actually.
Dark yellow colour. Sweet fruity aroma with a touch of hop and banana. Flavour has light banana sweetness and a dry bitter finish.

Bottle - 750mL crowned. Under the Biere de Garde moniker. Golden pour with a tall, fluffy white head. Aroma is fruity and floral with sweet malt notes, yeast, grass and candi sugar. Taste is very fruity and sweet with lots of malt notes, ripe fruits, yeast, candi sugar, grass, straw notes and bready malts. Body is medium with a strong, effervescent carbonation. Ends with more bready malts, sweet malt notes, fresh fruit, yeast, grassy notes, straw, floral hops and candi sugar. Tasty!
bottle at Remarkable Liquids. straw colored pour. fruity & floral yeastiness, straw/grass notes. medium body. OK
Bu en bouteille de 75cl, couleur blonde grosse mousse, bière intéressante au début de bouche mais qui fait beaucoup penser à une triple basique, pas incroyable non plus...
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Bel équilibre houblon/levures qui en fait une bière agréable à boire (enfin faut aimer le houblon quand même). Très correcte !

It poured a hazy dark golden color with an off-white head. The aroma was of notes of fruits, straw and some malts. The taste was sweet with notes of malt, caramel, straw, some flowers with a bitter finish.

Bottle from Rare Beer Club. Pours clear apple cider copper with rocky white head. Aroma: well, thats awfully pleasant. Bubble gum and cotton candy on the nose. Sort of a Dupont saison thing going on as well, with lemon, pepper and cracker. Taste: despite the cotton candy on the nose, this is remarkably dry. Mineral, pepper, with a short, crisp, lightly bitter finish. Bubblegum in the aftertaste. Copper finish picks up after the first few sips, but stays in check. Alcohol becomes a bit more present as well, lending something of a spicy quality. Palate: light/medium body, average carbonation. Overall: Im actually digging this quite a bit. Wasnt really expecting to coming into it, but Im glad I didnt let those reservations keep me from enjoying this one.
 
Also, watching Sideways while rating beer. Its funnier than I remember it, probably because I drink ("taste") now. Of course, Im only half an hour in as I type this, so it may fall apart before the end, but so far it aint bad.

Bottle with Chris. Pours a hazy gold with medium, creamy, white head and lasting lace. Aroma of citrus, pepper, honey, tea. Medium body with strong to moderate bitterness. Taste is citrus zest, sweet honey, candy, slight tropical notes

750, corked. Aaaaand thats it for the Rare Beer Club. Enough mediocre $46 shipments for this kid. Pours a hazy pale amber with a fizzy white head that hangs out for a while. Mild lemon and verbena nose, soft mineral notes. Fizzy light body. Starts out caramel, then goes coppery, then gets really coppery, and finishes really coppery.

Appearance: clear bright gold with a frothy, bubbly bright white head and decent lacing; second pour of the 750 revealed substantial sediment that changed the glass to a very hazy yellow.  Aroma: 	bright citrus up front, with herbal honey, uncooked pie crust, green tea, and pepper.  Taste: bitter citrus and floral hops, with herbal notes, a hint of tart green apple, and a bit of caramel and peppery yeast. Notes: 	dry, bitter, and lingering herb garden characteristics. Notes: 	Labeled as "Biere de Garde" but the write-up from the Rare Beer Club noted its the "Blonde". Pretty hoppy, herbal, and bitter for the style. Nice palate, but would have preferred a bit more honeyed sweetness to balance.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip. Pours translucent/hazy golden with big fluffy off-white head. Aroma is yeasty/floral hops, medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is yeasty, floral hops, some herbal hops, and a hint of skunk.

Pours a cloudy, straw-golden color with a very short-live large bubble, sudsy head. Bubble gum, Belgian spice, and banana on the nose. Full body with some light syrupiness. Flavors mimic the bouquet. Some pilsener bitterness at the finish.

33cl bottle from Saveur-biere.com. Hazy golden color, thick white head. Floral, fruity, juicy, yeasty aroma, oranges and some spicyness. Tasty blonde. Bitter dry, earthy and sweet fruity finish. Warming.

330ml bottle kindly shared by Finn. Pours a lasting white head to a cloudy golden body. Laces well. Wheat and semi-sweet fruity smell, notes of alcohol behind. Sappy sweet fruity taste profile, lightly spiced. Sweet ending with alcohol. Quite nice and smooth, rather sweet in the long run (Tromsø 19.02.2014).
Bottled as anosteke Biere de garde, hazy orange with big foam, herbal nose with a cloying menthol note on the flavor , herbal, not a fan

Flaske 0,33l fra Brune Rousse Houblon, Nice. Delt med Rune & Charly under samling på Nerstranda 19 Feb 14. Gylden. Litt uklar. OK skum som flater ut. Teppelacing. Aroma av søt frukt. Smaken er litt krydder. Svakt tørr ettersmak.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Citrus, Blumen. Geschmack sehr malzig, fruchtig herb, leicht nach Kräutern.

Bottle: Hazy yellow/golden color, white head. Aroma is malty with a light sweetness and honey note. Citrus fruitiness , flowerly. Flavor is light malty and sweet, notes of citrus fruitiness, citrus peel, flowerly. Citrus and light herbal hop bitterness.
C;ear golden yellow with white lacing foam head. Aroma is barley dominated, some hoppy, some floral. Tastes definaetly barley, some hay, some floral. Short bitter aftertaste. (Nantes, 201402)
Pours orange with off white head. Smells of yeast. Tastes of grass, bitter, and orange peel. Has mild lasting bitter.
Shared with Wim at his place. Clear goldblond coloured beer with medium white head and lots of carbonation. Spicy fruited and hoppy aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is hopped bitter.
Hazy orange body and white head. Aroma has yeast, some spicyness, wet malt. Flavour brings noble hoppiness and spicy alcohol. Nice though.
together with Yves at my home gold blonde colored sparkling body with a white head and a spicy yeast fruity hoppy aroma a spicy fruity sweet dry bitter taste with an alcholic bitter finish
Draft - Grains and some sweet fruit esters.  Cloudy amber with a bubbly head.  Fruity esters and grains with a bit of yeast.  Not all that great.

Bottle to wine glass
Fruity esters (banana), wheat and yeast. Cloudy amber with a cloudy and bubbly head. Taste is sweet and fruity with some yeast and a touch of bitterness.
Light amber color. Big estrery, dry hoppy, straw, gains of paradise, Dry, hoppy, oranges, grains of paradise the esters are a bit too strong though. Dry estery finish.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 19.11.13 Bottled 330ml Saveur. Deep golden color, small white head. Belgian yeasty fruity aroma, some malts and grass. Light to medium-bodied. Sweetish Belgian yeasty-fruity backbone, some green apple and hayish hoppyness. Palate is quite thin for this ABV but also feels less than 8 %. (6/3/6/2/11 2.8)
Re-rate at PBX IX. Nice fruity spiceyness and hop bite in the finish. Refreshing and better than previous bottle. (7/3/7/3/13 3.3)

Bue en pression au café des six roses (Lille).
Une vraie référence dans son domaine, une belle bière blonde houblonnée à souhait sans pour autant être une IPA.
A noter quen pression, son goût se montre plus tranchant et lamertume bien franche. La version bouteille est un poil plus ronde. Non refermentée en fût.

330 ml bottle. 13205. BB 01/2015. From saveur-biere.com.
Hazy dark golden colour with a small off-white head.
Sweet fruits, toffee, mild bitterness, mild yeast and some malt in the aroma. Not bad.
The flavour is a nice mixture of fruity hoppiness and Belgian style ale. Yeast, fruity hops, sweetness, malt and some bitterness in a tasty flavour. Tasty indeed. 8% very beautifully hidden. This Brasserie du Pays Flamand seems to brew quality drinks.

La confrérie des Tastebières de labbaye dAulps (Haute-Savoie, France) a inscrit lAnostéké blonde à son chapitre du 6 avril 2013. De sa dégustation par 15 confrères, les notations suivantes sont ressorties. 
Ainsi soit-il.

In short: A yeasty blonde ale with grassy-flowery hops. Decent beer.
How: From a bottle at Montreal Mondial 2013.
The look: Cloudy blonde body topped by an enormous white head, not a true gusher but it took a very loooonnnnng time to pour, it was just foam.
In long: After an eternity, multiple fall-foam pours each creating a little bit of beer Nose is hop-forward in an unusual way, it has dry grass, sundried countryside flowers, vanilla ice-cream, watermelons, bubblegum. Body had a foamy texture with a lots of big bubbles, an overall sponge-like mouthfeel. Taste proposes an elusive body, a fluffy yeasty mixture, some fresh bakery bread, a light honey presence, leading to a hoppy finish that is very scented/flowery and somewhat grassy. Too much of an overall perfume sensation but enjoyable nonetheless. Currently classified on ratebeer as an IPA, this is certainly not your usual IPA by ratebeer standards, more like a Belgian blonde ale that is more hoppy than usual. After drinking so many beers at the Mondial beer festival I had a strange dream, I dreamt it was raining beer outside, and in my dream I stayed inside to stay warm and dry, and now Im questioning everything I thought I knew about myself.

Boa Belgium IPA. Cor amarelo ouro, com ótima e persistente formação de espuma, aroma cítrico com evidente fermento belga. Na boca, corpo médio, com amargor em equilíbrio com as notas fermentadas. Álcool bem inserido, final alcoólico e aquecido. Ótima breja!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home from Terre de Boissons Calais. Aroma is earthy and yeasty some hay and lemon. Hazed orange pour with a gtreyish thin white head. Flavour is some earthy hay and lemon. Some alcohol bite in the finish, but it hides the 8% well. Medium full body. Medium yeast and lemon duration. Decent French beer who would have thought?

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com cons 2013-08-16 Göteborg
AR: pear ice cream, sharp yeast, glue - Perry when poured
AP: copper fizzy, fizzy medium steady white head no lacings
F: rich carbonation, Perry, sweet fruit syrup, medium low bitternees, a wee dryness on the tounge end, metanol, nice in the heat;), finishes a bit to sweet pear fruit syrup

33cl Bottle from erickok, thanks Eric! Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of cat piss, candy, sharp alcohol, grapes. Flavour is of grapes, some hot alcohol, light hoppy, soft candy sweetness, light fruity, some green banana, bitter hoppy and alcoholic finish. Light to medium-bodied, soft mouthfeel. Reminded me a bit of Duvel Tripel Hop 2012, but a lesser version. Nice BSA with extra hop, nowhere near an IPA.

33cl bottle from a shop in Poperinge. A refreshing blonde with bucketfuls of spiced fruits, apricot, peach and a flowery fragrance. Half way through I left it for 5 minutes while watching telly and when I took a sip I got a big mouthful of bubblegum. Not sure on the IPA classification but this is a great beer nonetheless.
Bottle sample at The Festival. Hazy golden color, fluffy white head. Aroma of dusty straw and subtle citrus. Taste is mildy saison-ish with decent body.

Bottle at The Festival. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is spicy and earthy hops with biscuit malt. Flavor is hoppy with crisp malt and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

On tap at the bar of Terre de Boissons, Coquelles, France. A hazy golden coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, fruity, malty aroma. Tastes similar, hoppy, fruity, yeasty, malty, slightly sweet. Wouldnt call this an IPA but it was pleasant.

A hazed blonde ale with a thin white head. In aroma, a sweet fruity malt with bananas, curacao and coriander. In mouth, a sweet perfumey malt with loads of coriander, alcohol warmth, orange pulp, nice.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours hazy dark orange in color with a whitish head. Orange peel, mild grassy notes and a bit of fruitcake in aroma. Quite fruity this one in taste with a bit of breadiness too. A bit yeasty notes with some spices. More like an abbey tripel this one.
Aroma e sabor muito bons, lúpulos na medida certa, equilibrada, pecando um pouco no corpo e na carbonatação, além de pouca persistência sensitiva no retrogosto.

Light misty golden colour and stable light grey head. Interesting aroma that balances fresh yeast, crisp hops of green leaves and herbs with a sweet peachy malt. Very nice original. Smooth body, tingling yet light carbonation and clearly a yeasty profile. Starts medium bitter and has a dry, tea like ending. Bit medicinal. Calling this an ipa doesnt do it justice at all. Its more of a Belgian style blond with interesting, off centered hop mix and light refreshing body. Like a hoppy bière de garde, but never American. Unique brew, give it a try. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

Bottle. Pours a godlen orange with a medium, white head. Aroma is fruity with peach and apricot, some marzipan and caramel as well as slight yeast. Taste is semisweet and spicy. The fruits are there again, mostly apricot though some peach as well. Light clovy spiciness. Dries up with some pine nettles on the finish. Palate is quite light and quite carbonated. Another one of these French "IPA"s with sweet, marzipan and apricot esthers from the yeast and not much hoppy assertiveness. Not bad, but not what I expect when getting an IPA.

Opening results in  a geyser of white foam, a desk full of beer and papers floating, slowly saturating, as well as in an explosion of herbal, green aromas, and finally in a meagre twenty cl of faintly veiled corn-yelliow beer interspeckled with miriad tiny UFOs. Oh, and a bit of foam.... Aromatic hops in evidence, faintly medicinal, dried herbs, touch of corn syrup and impressions of juniper branch, cypress and bog myrtle. Medicinal-hoppy, flavourwise. Bitter, but a tad indifferent. Greenmalt retronasal, more herbal notes. Spritzy... light to medium bodied. Deserving try, certainly too modest for an IPA. And guys... noaste kiê a bitje minder gazze, èh?

Ma première India Pale Ale, française et je la classe tout de suite dans celles quil me faudra faire découvrir aux copains. Bien équilibré, son fort houblonnage résineux tirant sur les agrumes est une vrai bonne surprise.

On tap at La Fine Mousse. Golden and clear with little grey head. Nose : tart, candy, fruits : cherry, banana, melon. Sip : good carbonation, creamy texture. Sweet and fruity. Tart and dominating melon. Aftertaste is yeast and bitter fruits. Nice one although too much mouthful.

Botted 330ml. -Courtesy of Marko (thanks!), shared with heavy and him.
Hazy yellow/golden coloured, medium sized white head, pleasant light agrumey nose. Moderate malty, flowery hoppy and agrumey taste with touch of green apple near the end. Really nice French IPA indeed, nice surprise.

Draught at La Fine Mousse, Paris.  Clear amber, rich head. Fruity nose with resinous hops. Mid sweet with above medium body and well rounded mouthfeel. Fruity with some honey and caramel, herbal hops and growing resiny bitterness.

33cl bottle from Terre de Boissons Calais.  Drunk from the bottle on the train home. Golden beer.  Hoppy strong belgian blonde aroma. Yeast is definitely Belgian. Yes its hoppier than normal and has some American style sherberty hops. I wasnt convinced it was an ipa more a strong belgian due to the yeast character. However the more I had of it the more it became an ipa. Good but with that Belgian twang. Clean American hops pale malt and characterful yeast I dont think always make good bedfellows. Good but I dont think it hangs together
Cerveja com ótimo aroma, bem encorpada e forte. Aparência bem escura e uma gosto muito bom.

330ml bottle. Pours hazy golden, lots of activity in the glass, nice white cloudy head which settles to a small residue atop the beer fairly quickly. Pungent, sweet resiny hops in the aroma, floral notes, some lemon/lemon zest and lime. Big dose of summer fruits (raspberry?!) in the flavour, backlit by more sharp hop bitterness. Medium carbonated and a little lively in the mouth, Alcohol is slightly apparent. Finish is long, dry and fruity. My first French craft beer, very pleasant.
Floral aroma of hops. Its color is light with a touch warmer. In flavor, it is perceived and roasted malts also lightweight. Final, a little dry and bitter in the spotlight.

333 from La Cave à Bulles. Opens a bit of a foamer. Not violent, but vigorously trying to leave. Nice aroma of floral, and perhaps earthy, hop. Med body. Flavor is floral hop - a lot of that- and some Belgian yeast/spice. Banana ester at low level. The Belgian aspect somewhat obscures the hop, but the finish retains a nice fresh floral aspect.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2012 Bottle from Celliers des Arcades, Arras. Hazy gold with a small white cap. Aroma is very fruity and impressive hop presence, pears, banana, and lots of awesome peach. Flavour is even better, same fruity elements, but the sweetness is kept in check by the hop presence and the dry yeast character. Finishes well with lingering esters. Super enjoyable, Ill have to pick up a 750mL bottle when I can. A simply awesome Belgian-style IPA.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty aroma with weak hoppy hints. Fruity malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty weak hoppy finish.

bottle in hotel room ... golden yellow ... big rising bubble ... big white foam head ... sweet yeasty ... syrupy summer fruits nose... bitter fruits .... soft orage ... mellow bready yeastyness ... in no way is this an ipa as its currenlty classified

Bottle from LAbbaye des Saveurs, LilleDeep blond color, with generous head. Interesting aroma, spicy yeast, and sweaty hops, mild fruitiness. Dry malts flavor, with strong bitterness, and some herbal character; spicy as well, coriander. A bit rough, but very good.

courtesy of Laurent Mousson - cloudy blond-orange beer under a chaotic yet long lasting white foam; fresh hoppy aroma of oranges and citrus, gently yeasty; slightly sticky and very tasty; a good malt backbone and a solid tart bitterness; long fruity hoppy finish with more citric notes - solid yet elegant; looks like a crossing between tripel and IPA

Bottle, unexpectedly discovered in the beer menu of Olympen, Oslo. This is my 1789th rating, so I found it very appropriate to select a French beer in honor of their revolution. :-) Pours a clear pale golden body with a big creamy white head. Nose is grass, pale malts and hints of soap and something I can only describe in terms of the classic Norwegian candy "bruspulver"; a sort of fizzy, grape-like sweetness. Weird. Taste is alcoholic phenols, strong banana tones, herbs and light candy sugars. Hints of soap and bubble gum. A bit strange all in all, not too bad but certainly nothing to start a revolution over. Still: Vive La France, keep trying! :-)

25/II/2012 33cl bottle from lAbbaye des Saveurs (Lille) @ home - BB: not printed on label as should be (2012-156) 
Little cloudy pale blond beer, big creamy head, stable, adhesive. aroma: very sweet, sugary, some citrus, ripe yellow fruis, bit grassy. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: citric start, some overripe fruits, sugary, medicinal bitteness,. Aftertaste: fairly bitter, still some sugar, overripe fruits, dry bitter ending.

couleur blonde dorée. Nez généreux sur les saveurs de fleurs blanches.
La bouche est intense, avec de belles notes dagrumes
Finale délicate et longue. Elle se prolonge sur une belle amertume.
chiara buona schiuma media persitenza leggermente speziata erbacea quasianice leggero zucchero candito
Bottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Clear yellow - white head. Soapy, berries, oldness, honey notes, light oxidation, fruity, hay, ok bitterness, nutty notes.

Bottle 330ml @ Papsoe
Pours clear golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, dried fruits and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle 330ml. @ [ Tasting by fiulijn ].Clear medium orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, pale malt, light to moderate hoppy, moderate yeasty, ripped fruit, bubble gum. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, malty, yeasty, fruity, hoppy, sharp, spicy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110916]

Bottle at Papsø.
Hazy golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops with notes of spices.
Sweet and fruity flavour of spices and hops.
Spicy finish.

hazy yellow, smooth white head.
yeasty, yellow fruity, aroma.
flavor is flowery, yellow fruity, malty. belgian yeast.

Bottled. A hazy dark golden beer with a huge, bubbly off-white head. The aroma has notes of fruits, straw, and a bit of malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, straw, and flowers, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of jaghana. Pours yellow with a slight haze and a dense and frothy white head. Sweet fruity and yeasty nose. Medium body, low carbonation, very soft mouthfeel, sweet fruit and heavy yeast with a little citrus. A little astringency in the finish. IPA?? More of a pale, strong Belgian Ale. 131011
(33cl bottle)  Pours a hazy golden body with a medium white head.  Aroma of grass, herbs, yeast, florals, and lemon.  Flavor of florals, herbs, melon, yeast, and banana.

07/05 0.33 l bottle courtesy of Doggythedog, thanks for sharing! It poured pale yellow hazy body with small head and some floating particles inside. Aromatic, but more sweet than harsh, fruity, especially peachy. Flavor is sweet, yeasty and a bit herbal hoppy. Elderflower and honey make it quite cloying. Fine long sweetish finish, very little citrus and herbal bitterness from hops. Too sweet for my taste, though I can appreciate this brew.
11.2oz bottle @RBSG-pours a white ring for a head and hazy straw color.  Aroma is lemon/grassy/spice, light malt.  Taste is lemon/grassy/spice hops.

33cl bottle, RBSG grand tasting, thanks EDA.  Clear straw body, medium white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, cantaloupe, some flower, light bread.  Taste is moderately sweet, cantaloupe, some straw/herbal, light flower, bread.  Medium body.
Bottle at RBSG. Pours clear gold. White head. Nose/taste of honey, yeast, citrus, bitter hops and caramel. Dry finish. Light to medium body.
33 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is roasted malty and phenolic.Dry, spiced and phenolic. Bitter and bone dry finish.
Aroma is perfume and wheat. A pale yellow pour with no head or lace.  Flavor is perfumy and a light earthy hops. No carbonation but pretty smooth. Decent.

Bottle, bought @ Cavée Bulles, Paris. [thanks big-bro]
Hazy pale golden with a small, frithy, white head. Aroma has elegant grassiness, peach, pine, crisp maltiness. Some lovely resin notes. Medium carbonation, dry and light creamy palate. Flavour has lovely herbal hops notes, crispy light douhgy malts. Extreme grassiness, citric, resiny, piney. Pine needles and fine bitterness. Actually a very fine ipa.

Botted 330ml. -Courtesy of Marko (thanks!), shared with heavy and him. 
Hazy yellow/golden coloured, medium sized white head, pleasant light agrumey nose. Moderate malty, flowery hoppy and agrumey taste with touch of green apple near the end. Really nice French IPA indeed, nice surprise.

Bottle from, humm, Abbaye des Saveurs in Lille I guess. Shared with the Croatian crew. Poured a hazy dull yellow body with a medium sized thick white head. Nice sweet malty honeyish nose with distinct note of orange, maybe some other agrumes, slightly yeasty and very nice. The taste is lovely, subtle, flowery, some light agrumes, elderflower, no trace of alcohol, slightly less bitter than I hoped but overall a superb beer, better than I expected!

Bottle in Paris. Cloudy, pale gold pour with a sturdy, white head. Very grassy aroma, with zesty lemon, hay, hints of grapefruit. Flavor is quite full, medium sweet with honey, bitter with rich grass, weeds, pine and citrus. Full in body with average carbonation. Pretty warm on the finish, zesty citrus, pear, faint metal, some yeast, tons of grassy hops and pine that sticks around. Excellent beer. Perhaps the best French beer I have yet had.

Bottle 33cl. A cloudy yellow beer with huge head. Nose is deep on hops bitterness and luppulin. A very interesting IPA kind of beer, spicy, grassy, intense bitterness, alpha hops, very vegetal, hay, very different as UK or US IPA I had until now. The floral and vegetable parts are there, nice bouquet, a good brew.

bottle from Village de la Bière Strasbourg. Hazy deep golden colour, mid-sized white head. Floral-hoppy nose with hints of citrus fruit. Full-bodied, slightly yeasty malty base with lots of floral aromatic hops, shy hints of orange marmalade, orange est, citrus fruit in general. A nice IPA with a French touch.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur blonde orangée, mousse correcte. Effectivement très houblonnée avec une amertume vraiment marquée, plus une pointe dacidité. Une bière authentique mais pas forcément super facile à boire. Trouvée au cellier des arcades - Arras

Yellow body with a slight fog, decent head but not very thick. Aroma of grass and caramel, some classic IPA perfume notes. Taste is a nice tart mix of caramel and overarching hops leading to a dry and aromatic finish. If you had told me the French could make a good IPA I would have laughed at you before tasting this, but its true!

Hops and mints, very liovely carbonation. Herbal, spicy, The secondary fermentation is maybe a bit out of hand, but anyway-
Solid herbal body, peppermint, flowery finish.

A beautiful Belgian white foam covers the cloudy opaque, yet shining gold. Bready and rather timid, yeasty nose with soft floral aromatics. A little underwhelming there for a wannabe IPA. In mouth, the palate starts with a healthy, balanced breadiness and well extracted cerealic flavours. growing in the background is a balanced hop-yeast combo that brings leafy, green, tea-like flavours that procure fruitiness and a lightly citrusy acidity that refreshes. Well integrated alcohol whispers. A balanced offerings with subtle corners that ends in dryness with a mineral and relatively long yet unagressive bitterness. Pretty active carbonation that fits the Belgian style all along. Well done.

Bottle from Roi du Potje Vleesch, Godewaersvelde. Hazy golden, lacing head. Very potent hop aroma, noticeable from quite a distance. It promises grass in big proportions. Sugary backdrop to grassy and slightly fruity hop flavours, all in abundance. Let me join the chorus of rejoice. The best French beer I have tasted to date, I think. Overshadows even the reliable Hommelbier just across the border.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2010 Tasted with Maltador. A very fine IPA, cleverly made. Lot of hops of course, but also nice mellowness on the back of the mouth. French hops bring tropical notes (mango) and sugar cane mellowness. Very tasty and bitter mouthfeel.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2010 A french IPA made with cascade and simcoe hops, but also with local hops. This is not an extreme IPA, it is beautifully balanced and well hopped. Just a touch of sugar comes alleviate bitterness and make the beer unctuous and incredibly persistent.
